We’re currently having trouble with our site <http://www.whichledlight.com|www.whichledlight.com> with it working on older IE browsers.. specifically we would like IE9 to actually work with it… does anyone know if any of these addons or dependencies screw up IE9. Routes to acquire a model don’t seem to work at all on IE9.
```
"devDependencies": {
   "broccoli-asset-rev": "^2.0.0",
```

<@U040LNZ6Y|kelvin> has joined the channel
would using older ember cli be a bad thing..? I think we didn't update to a newer version as we were reading that newer version was dropping support for older browsers
<@U04BD6KB1|ksnyde> has joined the channel

SCRIPT5022: Syntax error, unrecognised expression: [data-Times New Roman-offcanvas]
vendor.js, line 25 character 5366
that's what we get in the console

<@U04UJ2HMT>: Ember-CLI is a great tool but it is a new tool and as its evolving quickly I would say it’s a very good idea to stay fairly up-to-date with new versions. As for browser compatibility, that we be more down to the Ember version you’re using (which relates to CLI but is not equiv). I don’t have a succinct answer to the Ember to browser compatibility matrix, maybe someone else does?
thanks <@U04BD6KB1> , any one any ideas?
<@U04UJ2HMT>: I’m afraid that’s too little info for me by itself. What are you doing with “offcanvas”? Is this a jQuery plugin you’re using? Foundation maybe?
If you google that error you’ll find a number of people using Foundation with that error message.
it's our navigation, I've changed that over now as well :simple_smile:
yea, seems like the error message keeps coming up with foundation.. with other JS components, like dropdown..magnellan.. etc
oh, yes, offcanvas is foundation
i think the foundation js components that have come up in other peoples errors all require JQuery
